byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and ALEXANDER BURNS

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's proposal to hold 2016 Democratic National Convention in Brooklyn is rejected by party officials wary of logistical and security difficulties presented by location, and resistant to borough's unconventional appeal; convention will instead by held in Philadelphia.
lead_paragraph: In choosing Philadelphia for the 2016 presidential nominating site, party officials objected to having to erect a security zone in the residential area around the Barclays Center.

headline.main: Security Headaches Doomed Brooklyn Bid for Democratic Convention
headline.print_headline: Security Headaches Doomed Brooklyn Bid for Democratic Convention

snippet: In choosing Philadelphia for the 2016 presidential nominating site, party officials objected to having to erect a security zone in the residential area around the Barclays Center.
